net.kyori.event

Class SimpleEventBus<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.kyori.event.SimpleEventBus<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventBus<E>

    public class SimpleEventBus<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventBus<E>
    A simple implementation of an event bus.

      • eventCancelled

        protected boolean eventCancelled(E event)
        Returns if a given event instance is currently "cancelled".

        The default implementation of this method uses the Cancellable interface to determine if an event is cancelled.

        Parameters:
        event - the event
        Returns:
        true if the event is cancelled

      • eventGenericType

        protected @Nullable java.lang.reflect.Type eventGenericType(E event)
        Gets the generic Type of a given event.

        The default implementation of this method uses the ReifiedEvent interface to read the generic type of an event.

        Parameters:
        event - the event
        Returns:
        the generic event type, or null if unknown

      • shouldPost

        protected boolean shouldPost(E event,
                             @NonNull EventSubscriber<?> subscriber)
        Tests if the event should be posted to the subscriber.

        The default implementation of this method tests for cancellation status and matching event/subscriber generic types.

        Parameters:
        event - the event
        subscriber - the subscriber
        Returns:
        true if the event should be posted

      • subscribers

        public @NonNull com.google.common.collect.SetMultimap<java.lang.Class<?>,EventSubscriber<?>> subscribers()
        Description copied from interface: EventBus
        Gets an immutable multimap containing all of the subscribers currently registered.

        Each subscriber is mapped to the type defined when it was initially registered.

        Specified by:
        subscribers in interface EventBus<E>
        Returns:
        a multimap of the current subscribers
